thesis.description: In our society a man’s occupation is of prime importance in his life. It determines his social and economic status, his associates, his leisure activities, hie entire mode or life. Discrepancy between the kind of job a person has and the kind of job he would like to have, tends to lead to job dissatisfaction and frequent shifting of jobs which may seriously affect personality and emotional adjustment. Since occupational aspirations are salient factors in job satisfaction, and thereby in the total adjustment of the individual, studies of the level of aspiration of job applicants have important implications for vocational guidance. Knowledge of an individual’s vocational hopes and expections, as well as an assessment of his vocational potentialities, may point out the way in which he can best be assisted in finding the job which most adequately meets his qualifications, his interests and his needs.
thesis.creator: Sofin, Rosalie A.
thesis.subject: PSYCHOLOGY, APPLIED.
OCCUPATIONS.
thesis.title: The level of aspiration of job applicants.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Human tumour xenogeneic systems were developed using colonic adenocarcinomas and the J-Ill human leukemic cell line. Satisfactory xenogeneic transplants of J-iII cells were developed regularly with the use of anti-Iymphocyte sera (ATS) and by the induction of immunologic tolerance. Transitory growth of adenocarcinomas was obtained with ATS and dexamethasone, and also in animals previously made tolerant to J-iII cells. The colonic adenocarcinoma xenografts retained their morphologic and immunologic characteristics, at least as far as the persistence of their tumour specific antigen (CEA) was concerned. Localization of a group of J-ill tumours growing in rats with radiolabelled anti J-ill antibody was carried out. The results of the autoradiographs and scans obtained were interpreted, and consideration was given to the ideal methods which may provide further confirmation of these findings in the future.
thesis.creator: Machado, Helder
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Human tumor xenografts
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This study appraises the traditional view that free trade is the best policy that the less developed countries could adopt in order to stimulate their development. It examines the original case for free trade as well as the criticisms which have been advanced on the theoretical level and with respect to the actual role played by international trade in economic development. Since the debate on these issues is far from being over, no definite conclusions were reached. It was found nevertheless that most economists have come to recognize special circumstances in the case of developing economies. As a consequence, they have come to believe that the role of trade as an agent of development should be considered in the light of the particular situations of individual countries, rather than attempting to apply given principles or policies to all situations.
thesis.creator: Lepore, Giuseppe
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: International trade: its relevance to less developed countries
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The effects of the heterogeneity of rat adrenal tissues ofdifferent preparations, and of other controllabl~ factors on the corticosteroidogenesis from labeled steroid precursors were studied. A double isotope method for the simultaneous measurement of the specific activities and internaI productions of steroids was used. [...]
thesis.creator: Lee, David S.
thesis.subject: Rat adrenal tissue
thesis.title: Factors influencing hydroxylations of labeled steroid precursors by different rat adrenal preparations
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In 1927 Aschheim and Zondek announced their discovery of a gonadotrophic substance in the urine of pregnant women; and based on this finding they established their well known test for pregnancy. They described three reactions which followed its administration to immature female mice or rats: I. Development of follicles, and resulting oestrus changes in the vagina and uterus. II. Hemorrhage into the follicles. III. Formation of corpora lutea. They maintained that conclusive demonstration of the presence of this substance, which they termed prolan, demanded the production of reactions II and/or III. [...] However this substance is found in body fluids and tissues only in the presence of living chorionic tissue, as during normal pregnancy in women or when pathological chorionic tissue is present. Evidence has since been presented to show that it originates from chorionic cells and not from the anterior pituitary, hence the designation, chorionic gonadotrophic hormone first suggested by Hamburger and which has been generally adopted. Moreover it has not been found possible to separate this substance into “A” and “B” fractions by methods which have been used in separating anterior pituitary extracts into follicle stimulating and luteinizing fractions. Each of these hormones present certain physiological and chemical differences.
thesis.creator: Stollmeyer, John E.
thesis.subject: Medicine.
thesis.title: The metabolism of chorionic gonadotrophin.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Transketolase (E.C 2.2.1.1) was purified 12-fold from an extract of dried Candida utilis by two fractionations with acetone followed by chromatography on DEAE-Sephadex. The fractions from the column were free from D-ribose 5-phosphate ketol isomerase (E.C 5.3.1.6) and D-ribulose 5-phosphate-3-epimerase (E.C 5.1.3.1) and could be used for the assay of D-xylulose 5-phosphate and of epimerase. Three peaks of transketolase activity were eluted from the chromatographic column; the material from each peak had a Michael is constant for D-xylulose 5-phosphate close to the mean value for the three peaks of 6.8 x 10^-5 M. When transaldolase (E.C 2.2.1.2) was present in the material placed on the column it appeared with transketolase in each of the three peaks. Cellulose acetate electrophoresis of the three peak tubes containing both transketolase and transaldolase gave the same two-banded pattern. The enzyme could be stored for several months in solution frozen at -10°.
thesis.creator: Kiely, Maureen E.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: An investigation of the purification of transketolase and D-ribulose 5-phosphate-3-epimerase
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the last few years, G.W.H. Norman of the Department of Mines and Resources, Mines and Geology Branch, Ottawa, mapped in detail an area extending from Malartic on the west to Louvicourt Township on the east. This work yielded so much information, and prospecting was so extensive in this area, that the Geological Survey extended the work eastward from Norman’s sheet. Three parties were organized in 1946 each to map one township at a scale of 1000 feet to one inch. One party under H.C. Norman mapped Vauquelin Township, the writer mapped Pershing Township, and the third party under K. Dawson mapped Haig Township. The work was under the supervision of G.W.H. Norman.
thesis.creator: Tiphane, Marcel, 1917-
thesis.subject: Geological Science.
thesis.title: Pershing township map-area
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The formation and release of surplus acetylcholine was studied in perfused sympathetic ganglia of cats. Surplus acetylcholine is the extra acetylcholine that accumulates in the presence of choline and an anticholinesterase. Surplus acetylcholine formed rapidly when eserine was the anticholinesterase, but slowly when neostigmine or ambenonium was used. Chronically decentralized ganglia synthesized no surplus acetylcholine. These experiments suggested that surplus acetylcholine was stored presynaptically and the results were discussed in relation to the location of acetylcholinesterase. Surplus acetylcholine was labelled by perfusing resting ganglia with eserine-3H-choline-Locke. Subsequent stimulation of the preganglionic nerve failed to release radioactivity although unlabelled acetylcholine was released. These experiments suggested that surplus acetylcholine did not mix with releasable transmitter. Perfusion with high-K+ or acetylcholine or carbachol injections effectively released surplus acetylcholine, but the released acetylcholine did not augment the ganglion-stimulant effect of carbachol. These results were discussed in relation to the synthesis and storage of acetylcholine.
thesis.creator: Katz, Howard S.
thesis.subject: Physiology.
thesis.title: The formation and release of surplus acetycholine by a sympathetic ganglion
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Experiments were carried out in Swiss white mice in an attempt to find possible methods of transmission of Cocal virus. Following subcutaneous inoculation, viraemia was detected only in suckling mice, indicating that only young animals could serve as virus source for haematophagus arthropods. There was no transmission by direct contact between adult mics following intradermal inoculation, but two of ten mice contracted Cocal infection from their intranasally inoculated partners. When five mice were exposed to each infected mouse, there was no transmission. A limited study was made of the method of invasion of the central nervous system after inoculation of Cocal virus by different routes. Subcutaneous infection of suckling mice appeared to result in haematogenous invasion, with the possibility of occasional neural spread. The central nervous system of intranasally inoculated adult mice was infected by the olfactory route, while that of intradermally infected mice appeared to be infected along peripheral nerves.
thesis.creator: Hull, Barbara P.
thesis.subject: Microbiology and Immunology.
thesis.title: Cocal virus infections in Swiss white mice
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: An antiviral substance from <<Penicillium cyaneo-fulvum>>, exhibiting the properties of a polysaccharide, has been shown not to exert its antiviral activity by the stimulation of interferon under the experimental conditions employed in this investigation. The test system used for the detection of interferon consisted of chick embryo fibroblast tissue cultures challenged with influenza A virus, PR8 strain. The amount of virus was measured by the quantitative hemadsorption technique. Conditions for the detection or interferon were established using a commercial interferon standard. The antiviral agent, in its semipurified form, gave a dose-response curve as measured by quantitative hemadsorption and no toxic effects on the tissue cultures were observed. The presence of a virus in the McGill strain of the mold has been confirmed by electron-microscopy.
thesis.creator: Homola, Eva M.
thesis.subject: Microbiology and Immunology.
thesis.title: An antiviral substance from Penicillium cyaneo-fulvum: studies on interferon induction
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Some have suggested that post-vagotomy diarrhea and steatorrhea are due to intestinal mucosal atrophy, lasting five months. This atrophy is supposedly due to the decreased gastrointestinal mucosal perfusion shown to acutely follow vagotomy. Patterns of radioactive p32 uptake in vivo showed canine gastric mucosal vascular volume to be double, and perfusion rate to be half, that of the jejunum or ileum. Thoracotomy and laparotomy together, caused a doubling of jejunal (but not of gastric or ileal) mucosal vascular volume and perfusion, lasting four to six weeks. Concomitant vagotomy shortened this response to less than three weeks. There was no evidence of diminished perfusion in these chronic studies with or without vagotomy. The vascular responses coincide with reports of increased epithelial cell survival after laparotomy. Mucosal distortion and damage followed the surgery, and lasted less than six weeks, regardless of vagal status. Mucosal cellular metabolism studies revealed no alterations.
thesis.creator: Hewson, John R.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Effects of vagotomy on the gastrointestinal tract: a study of the long-term effects of vagotomy upon the hemodynamics, histology, and mucosal metabolism of the canine gastrointestinal tract
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is odd that in any work on economics it should be necessary to discuss the importance of studying economic change. The classical school of political economy never gave the problem a thought; to it the study of economic development was synonymous with the study of all economics itself. However, after Karl Marx there arose a completely new way of approaching this subject: phenomena were now always studied in relation to a static model, from which all element of time was removed. This method of economic analysis was so highly developed and has become so ingrained in the minds of most economists that it now becomes necessary to ask why we should study economic change. An odd state of affairs, indeed! Although Schumpeter re-introduced the subject of economic development in 1911 with the publication of his “Theory of Economic Development” in German, the study of long-run trends has never again become the fashion, economists having recently devoted themselves either to furthering the study of static analysis or to examining the short-run problems of the business cycle. The need for a well-rounded theory of economic development is still great. This thesis attempts to make some contribution by evaluating the work of four outstanding theorists of change: Smith, Ricardo, Marx, and Schumpeter. [...]
thesis.creator: Albert, Ruth R.
thesis.subject: Economic history.
Economics.
thesis.title: A critical evaluation of the theories of economic change of Smith, Ricardo, Marx and Schumpeter.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A spontaneous pancreatic islet change, consisting of intra- and peri-insular fibrosis and enlargement in Sprague Dawley rats is described. This change is shown to be age and sex dependent since it occurs in adult and old male rats and is beneficially influenced by estrogen treatment. The islet alteration is associated with decreased glucose tolerance and inadequate serum insulin levels. Thus, this spontaneous model in an easily available laboratory animal may be of use for studying prediabetes and diabetes mellitus. Investigations carried out in young and aging male animals with or without this pancreatic islet alteration suggest that in aging animals a change of carbohydrate metabolism develops that leads to functional deficiencies of the islets. Islet fibrosis and enlargement represents a compensation attempt that fails and results in further deterioration of the islet function.
thesis.creator: Hajdu, Andrew
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: The morphological and functional significance of a spontaneous pancreatic islet change in the rat
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Methods have been developed for the isolation of the two molecular sizes of the γc-globulin from bovine CSF, bovine colostrum and human CSF. These fluids were concentrated in Visking dialysis tubing under pressure and the filtrates concentrated by ultrafiltration. While γc-globulins were the only antigens in the Visking tubing (Vt) filtrates that could be detected with anti-CSF sera, three other proteins were revealed by disc gel electrophoresis. The smaller form of the colostral γc-globulin was separated from these impurities by filtration through Sephadex G-75. Its molecular weight was found to be about 15,000 by gel filtration. The larger γc-globulin was isolated from bovine CSF retained in the dialysis tubing by ammonium sulfate precipitation and chromatography on Sephadex G-75. Purification of the larger γc-globulin from colostrum required successive filtrations through Sephadex gels of increasing porosity. The molecular size was found to be 30,000 by gel filtration.
thesis.creator: Feldmuller, Francois
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Isolation and purification of a brain protein
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Because anxiety is a term which is used in a variety of contexts, a definition of it, as used in this paper, is necessary. Warren’s Dictionary of Psychology defines anxiety as “an emotional attitude or sentiment concerning the future, characterized by an unpleasant mingling of dread and hope”. MacKinnon (1944) writes that anxiety occupies the intermediate position in the series of prospective emotions made up of confidence, hope, anxiety, despondency and despair. Mowrer (1939) defines anxiety as anticipation of painfully intense stimulation. Masserman (1944) sees anxiety as “a diffuse, pervading apprehensiveness without specific or clearly recognized (conscious) reality referents”. Billings (1939) regards it as “a feeling of uneasiness and an unpleasant expectancy of something about to happen without a certainty of its coming to pass”. According to Kubie (1941), anxiety is “a protective anticipatory signal for the outbreak of the startle state”. For Young (1943) the term anxiety designates a persistent state in which there is a foreboding of evil”. In all of the foregoing definitions there is one common element. This is denoted by the words: concerning the future, prospective emotion, anticipation, apprehensiveness, expectancy and foreboding. In each case anxiety is seen as an uneasy feesling about what is to come. This idea is fundamental to a definition of anxiety and on this point there is general agreement. [...]
thesis.creator: Amsel, Abram.
thesis.subject: PSYCHOLOGY -- MENTAL TESTS.
ANXIETY.
PSYCHOLOGY, PATHOLOGICAL.
thesis.title: Effect of anxiety state upon intra-serial interference in rote learning of nonsense syllables.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The daily administration of vincristine sulfate, an oncolytic alkaloid, caused a characteristic myopathy in rats within 4 days. Histochemically the lesions in the diseased muscle suggested an accumulation of phospholipid. Within 24 hours of a single intraperitoneal injection (0.4 mg./kg. body weight), the drug caused a significant increase in the lipid phosphorus concentration in the gastrocnemius muscle. The liver and brain were unaffected. In the muscle the relative concentration of phosphatidyl ethanolamine was increased, and the relative concentrations of sphingomyelin and polyglycerophosphatides were decreased as determined by quantitative thin layer chromatography. Using 32p and 14C-L-acetate the specific activities of the phospholipids of muscle were increased by vincristinetreatment. Liver was unaffected. Systemic vincristine-treatment caused a decrease in the specific activity of cerebral phospholipids which did not occur, however, when the drug was given intracranially. In the muscle the increase in specific activity was greatest in the phosphatidyl ethanolamine fraction. Vincristine-treatment caused a marked increase in the specific activities of the cholesterol of muscle and liver after 14C-L-acetate administration. It did not, however, produce any change in the concentrations of cholesterol in the tissues.
thesis.creator: Clarke, Joe T.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The effect of vincristine sulfate on the metabolism of phospholipids in skeletal muscle of the rat
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The investigation to be described in this thesis forms part of a larger research on blood preservation and plasma substitutes that has been carried on in the Department of Biochemistry since the first year of the war [...] The present study was conceived at a time in the evolution of blood preservation when there was little agreement amongst workers on this Continent and in Great Britain on the matter of so-called preservative solutions for the preservation of erythrocytes. Special committees had been formed in the early years of the war under the Research Councils in Canada and the United States to deal with matters pertaining to blood preservation, plasma substitutes and the treatment of shock. This move in enlisting all the research personnel in a collaborative and systematic study in which each research group was assigned a particular phase of the problem marked a beginning of a real progress in the improvement of blood preservation and the treatment of shock.
thesis.creator: Andreae, Shirley Rogan.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Chemical changes in stored blood.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The dissociation of heme proteins, catalases (bovine and equine liver and equine erythrocyte) and hemoglobins (avian: chick and duck, and mammalian: human adult, human fetal, equine and bovine) has been studied in the presence of ionic solutes: LiCl , NaCl, KCl, CaCl2 and MgCl2 and nonionic solutes: formamide, urea, guanidine-HCl and 2-chloroethanol and at high alkaline pH. The extent of dissociation depended on the nature of the solvent composition. Catalases dissociated at a low protein concentration. Soret band intensity of the heme proteins studied remained unaffected in presence of uni-univalent ionic solutes but diminished with bi-univalent and non-ionic solutes and high pH. Fluorescence emission spectra of catalases showed an increase in relative fluorescence intensity and a red shift in the emission maximum with the bi-univalent solutes and non-ionic solutes. Fluorescence emission spectra of catalases were affected by pH. Both types of solutes and high pH affected the enzymic and antigenic activities of bovine liver catalase. The extent of renaturation under conditions of solvent perturbation, temperature and pH depended on the degree of denaturation. The properties of bovine liver catalase under charge modification using succinylation, acetylation, carbamidomethylation and reductive cleavage have been studied. Bovine liver and equine erythrocyte catalases were more resistant to dissociation, than equine liver catalase. Avian hemoglobins were more resistant to dissociation than mammalian hemoglobins.
thesis.creator: Chen, Anthony B.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Studies on the conformational stability of heme proteins
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Calf-thymus and mouse Erlich ascites carcinoma DNA-RNA hybrids were prepared by transcribing denatured DNA in vitro with RNA polymerase. The hybrids were purified by chromatography on methylated albumin kieselguhr after digesting the unhybridized nucleic acid with Neurospora crassa endonuclease. The sedimentation constants of both calf-thymus (11% and 19% pure) hybrids and mouse-tumor (28% pure) hybrid in sucrose gradients were approximately 4S. The hybrids melted at 73 – 76 °c (in 0.1M Tris-HCl, pH 7.5, 0.01M MgCl2 , 0.1M NaCl). In Cs2SO4 density gradients the hybrids banded at a buoyant density of 1.52 gm cm^-3, and were purified 2 -fold by separation of native DNA contaminant (1.46 gm cm^-3). The isolation of DNA-tRNA hybrid, by an extension of these techniques, would allow studies on pure tRNA cistrons.
thesis.creator: Allen, Glenna
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Some properties of DNA-RNA hybrids
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The thesis deals with the Cuban government's decision to nationalize American property in the two-year period following Fidel Castro's assumption of power in January, 1959. Chapter One introduces and out1ines the main body of the work. Chapter Two deals with the operational environment between 1898 and 1959 in relation to Cuban-American interaction on a political and economic level. Chapter Three discusses the operational environment, 1959-1960, outlining steps taken by the Cuban elite to fulfill their revolution and the resultant opposition by the United States. Chapter Four examines the psychological environment of the Cuban decision-makers, especially Fidel Castro and Ernesto Che Guevara. Chapter Five concludes by analysing the rationality and reason of the Cuban elite in making this decision.
thesis.creator: Srebrnick, Henry F.
thesis.subject: Political Science.
thesis.title: Cuban-American relations: the Cuban decision to nationalize American property
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The problem of determining a statistical population belonging to a certain class of distributions is widely investigated in Mathematical Statistics. Of special interest is the characterization of the Normal distribution. In this thesis, characterizations of the Normal distribution through different considerations are treated in great detail. Chapter II is concerned with the characterization of the Normal distribution by using specified or unspecified distributions of suitable statistics. Chapter III deals mainly with the property of independence of suitable statistics, such as linear statistics, linear and quadratic statistics, linear and polynomial statistics, by which the Normal distribution is characterized. Chapter IV gives some generalizations of some results in Chapter III by replacing the property of independence by a weaker condition of regression such as constant regression and polynomial regression. Finally, Chapter V discusses the characterization of the Normal distribution through linear structural relations and through properties of sample estimators. Other characterizations which do not fall into the preceding categories are mentioned at the end of Chapter V.
thesis.creator: Goh, Jeok-Eng
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: Characterizations of the normal distribution
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It has been thought since the early days of medical practice that the liver and gastro-intestinal tract play a very important role in the pathogenesis of mental disorders. References to this belief may be found in the literature of the classical ages. Indeed, one of the principle symptoms of mental disorder, melancholia, derives its name from the Greek word ,”melagkholia”, which means “black” (melas) “bile” (khole). In the fourth century B.C. Hippocrates expressed the belief that bile was the cause of madness. A sudden flux of bile to the brain was thought to bring on unpleasant dreams and feelings of anxiety; a superabundance of black bile caused melancholia. Aristotle (384 - 322 B.C.) formulated a similar hypothesis. He believed that the soul was unable to function without warmth. Black bile was merely the carrier of heat and cold; moderate coldness led to vertigo, apprehensiveness, or a state of being stunned. Coldness led to cowardice and stupidity, warmth caused gaiety and free joy, while great heat was associated with amorous desires and cleverness. [...]
thesis.creator: Askonas, Brigitte A.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Detoxication in psychiatric disorders.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This investigation comprises a search for a suitable microanalysis for gelatin, as required for a study of the gelatin concentration in the cathode film during copper electrodeposition, no suitable analysis being found in the literature. Measurements of cathode polarization, in a Haring cell of small capacity, proved unsuitable for microanalysis of gelatin in the cathode film during copper electrodeposition, even with closely controlled experimental conditions, owing to depletion of the gelatin content of the electrolyte on continued deposition. The substitution of SO cycle alternating current for direct current in the same cell showed that electrode polarization measurements gave promise of eventually providing the required analysis, preliminary trials only being completed. The results of these investigations, while throwing light on the importance of gelatin depletion, served to confirm Gauvin’s hypothesis for the mechanism of the action of gelatin, that the colloid, being adsorbed on part of the active cathode area, would cause an increase in current density and therefore in cathode polarization. The attainment of a steady and reproducible cathode polarization value seemed unlikely because of the depletion of the electrolyte.
thesis.creator: Atkinson, James Thomas Nesbitt.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Studies with the Haring cell : an investigation of the gelatin concentration in the cathode film during copper electrolysis.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Les données du radar et celles fournies par un réseau de pluviomêtres furent analysées pour 5 orages qui totalisèrent 9 heures de pluie et qui se produisirent entre le 25 juillet et le 19 août 1969. Avec les données du radar (λ=10 cm), on détermina la valeur relative du facteur de réflectivité Z pour un volume de l'atmosphère situé à environ 5,000 pieds au-dessus des pluviométres dont le nombre varia entre 4 et 7 selon l'orage. En supposant une relation de la forme Z=AR^1.6, on calcula l'intensité de la pluie R pour une valeur de référence Z1 en comparant pour chaque orage la pluie estimée à celle observée. L'écart entre ces valeurs équivaut à 6 dB en Z et signifie que l'utilisation, pour tous les orages, d'une relation moyenne permet d'évaluer la quantité de pluie entre 65% et 154%. L'utilisation de la relation appropriée pour un orage donné peramet de mesurer entre 80% et 125% de la quantité de pluie qui tombe à un endroit quell-conque tandis que la valeur estimée pour l'intensité R est telle que 50% des mesures indiquent un écart inférieur à 20% et 90% sont précises à plus de 50%.
thesis.creator: Desautels, Gilles
thesis.subject: Meteorology.
thesis.title: Mesure de la pluie par radar et par pluviometres
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis is organized to look upon the entire air transportation system with special emphasis in the circulation of Airport Terminals. In attempting to achieve an understanding of the problem, all the subsystems have been examined in depth. Considering the ground and VTOL/STOL access of the airport with the city, special considerating has been taken. Finally the target of the study has been concentrated in the area of interterminal transportation for passenger and cargo movements.
thesis.creator: Vafiadis, Constantine
thesis.subject: Architecture.
thesis.title: Circulation trends in air terminals; existing and possible future systems approach
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
